Statistical Data CD-ROM Subscriptions

International Financial Statistics on CD-ROM

The IFS Database and Browser on CD-ROM is keyed closely to the printed issues of IFS. It also contains historical data presented with a greater degree of precision than in the printed issues. Quarterly and monthly entries generally begin in 1957, and most annual entries begin in 1948. The CD-ROM incorporates a Windows-based browser facility, as well as the flat file of the database in scientific notation. The browser software provides a familiar and easy-to-use Windows interface for browsing the database, selecting series of interest, displaying the selected series in a spreadsheet format, and saving the selected series for transfer to other software systems, such as Microsoft Excel.

Balance of Payments Statistics on CD-ROM

The BOPS Database and Browser on CD-ROM has adapted the Balance of Payments Statistics Yearbook; therefore, it contains balance of payments and international investment position data of individual countries, regional and world totals for major components of the balance of payments, and descriptions of methodologies, compilation practices, and data sources used by selected reporting countries. In addition to corresponding series and tables within the Balance of Payments Statistics Yearbook, the BOPS CD-ROM contains data as reported by the balance of payments correspondents to the IMF Statistics Department. The BOPS Database and Browser on CD-ROM incorporates a Windows-based browser facility, as well as the flat file of the database in scientific notation. The new browser software provides a familiar and easy-to-use Windows interface for browsing the database, selecting series of interest, displaying the selected series in a spreadsheet format, and saving the selected series for transfer to other software systems, such as Microsoft Excel.

Direction of Trade Statistics on CD-ROM

Deriving its source data from the Direction of Trade Statistics, the DOTS Database and Browser on CD-ROM provides an easy-to-use interface for browsing the database, selecting series of interest, displaying the selected series in spreadsheet format, and saving the selected series for transfer to other software systems such as Microsoft Excel. Data are available for approximately 180 countries from 1980 onwards and include estimated data from 1981. It includes four views for browsing the database; a table view corresponding to the tables contained within the Direction of Trade Statistics Yearbook; an economic concept view that provides access to similar concepts across countries, to the extent that they exist; a cross-country matrix view; and a search mechanism based on the structure of the time series key.

Direction of Trade Statistics
Historical Database and Browser on CD-ROM

Subscribers to the Direction of Trade Statistics on CD-ROM will automatically receive at no additional cost this new product, which complements the monthly DOTS Database and Browser on CD-ROM. The Historical Database contains more than 55,000 time series of annual, quarterly, and monthly trade data for approximately 200 countries from 1948 to 1980. The database can be accessed interactively, via an easy-to-use Window interface for browsing, or directly—via the "flat" file—stored in scientific notation format.

Government Finance Statistics on CD-ROM

The Government Finance Statistics on CD-ROM contains time series from 1990 onwards using the Government Finance Statistics Manual 2001 framework. The CD-ROM is issued quarterly, and updated as new data are received and time series become available. The CD-ROM incorporates a Windows-based browser facility for accessing the database, selecting specific data series, displaying the selected series in an spreadsheet format, and saving the selected series for transfer to other software systems, such as Microsoft Excel.

A new matrix view, the Integrated Statement of Flows and Stocks, was added to the Government Finance Statistics on CD-ROM in March 2006. The Integrated Statement of Flows and Stocks complements the existing country table views (by classification of transactions and by subsector) and economic concept view, as well as the current matrix view that supplements the presentation in the Government Finance Statistics Yearbook (GFSY). By breaking down the total assets and total liabilities into their constituent components and establishing the sources of changes in them from one period to another in terms of transactions and other economic flows, the framework provides a strong statistical explanation of the factors underlying the change in the net worth of government.

Government Finance Statistics 1986 Historical Database and Browser on CD-ROM (1972-1989)

Subscribers to Government Finance Statistics on CD-ROM will receive, at no additional cost, this new [product, which complements the monthly GFSM 2001 Database and Browser on CD-ROM (1990 to present). The new GFSM 1986 Historical Database and Browser on CD-ROM (1972-1989) contains more than 19,000 time series of annual GFS data for 149 countries compiled using the analytical framework of A Manual on Government Finance Statistics, 1986 (GFSM 1986). A guidance note on the linkages between the GFSM 1986 and the GFSM 2001 frameworks is included on this CD-ROM. This database can be accessed interactively, via an easy-to-use Windows-based browser, or directly —via a "flat" file— stored in scientific notation format.

What You'll Need
Each Database and Browser product operates using a standard CD-ROM disk drive interfaced with a PC. The browser software is a 32-bit application, requiring a 32-bit operating system (Windows 95, Windows 98, or NT 4.0) and a minimum screen resolution of 800 X 600 (1024 X 768, if large fonts are used). The following minimum configuration is recommended: Quad Speed (4X) CD-ROM drive, 90 MHz speed processor, and 16 MB of RAM.

Network or Time-Sharing License
Users may wish to incorporate these CD-ROM products into a network, or provide online time-sharing services. Please contact Publication Services for information on obtaining a network or time-sharing license.

Important Note
Each CD-ROM subscription requires adherence to a license agreement that accompanies each disc. Information retrieved from the CD-ROMs may be used for internal purposes only. It may not be sold, rented, or otherwise provided to any third party.

Annual Subscription to CD-ROMs
$520.00 a year for a single-user PC license. This includes 12 monthly discs (conforming to the High Sierra standard), fully featured retrieval software, user documentation, and priority mail delivery.

Academic Subscription to CD-ROMs
$295.00 a year for a single-user PC license. A special subscription is available only to full-time university professors and full-time students. This subscription includes four quarterly discs, fully featured retrieval software, user documentation, and priority mail delivery to university addresses only. (Libraries must order the regular subscription.)
